ygData.subject: Oncoming Death.
ygData.msgSnippet: ** Dinobot could feel the soreness in his joints and he wanted more then anything to simply rest and give his body time to recover. However, his systems had

** Dinobot could feel the soreness in his joints and he wanted more then 
anything to simply rest and give his body time to recover.
However, his systems had their own ideas, which rest and recovery was none.
His fourth fluid pump was almost completely activated, and with the 
deactivation of it was also the deactivation of his existence in general.
He glanced over towards Tavatron, whom seemed to keep near him and with his 
pace.
She had no idea just how close to actual death he was right at that moment 
and all because that was what he was intending.
The last thing she needed now was to know that his last fluid pump was 
failing, and his repair systems didn�t have enough mech-fluid to operate on.
And his cover was perfect, maybe even a little TOO perfect.
He never faltered now, never led on with anything that might suggest that he 
could simply die there any moment�or rather, the moment when his last pump 
failed.
But right now, while that might dwell in his thoughts, the need to get to 
the CR room was more dominant.
Dinobot snarled as more mech-fluid continued to drip from his fangs, hearing 
the transmission from their third in command over Tavatrons� communicator.
So, they HAD been expecting them. Rather surprising.
He saw Tavatron answer and then carry on in the general direction suggested, 
apparently towards the CR room.
With a slight groan of his gears he followed, his entire body feeling much 
more heavier then he knew it should.
Dinobot kept his eyes on Tavatron as they entered into a hall, growling as 
he realized just what would happen once he got to the intended destination.
Indeed, he would need help, or just maybe.
He needed fluids, but as soon as he transformed into robot mode to receive 
them his last fluid pump would fail and he would slowly begin to die.
First his lungs would do, completely deactivating them and shutting off any 
hope of drawing another breath.
Cutting off all air to the brain, eventually suffocating it.
So, basically, he had 20 cycles to pump enough fluids into his body to 
activate his repair system to save himself in time before he basically 
went�brain dead.
Dinobot snarled and clenched his fist, but he might also go right into 
stasis lock, and while he was out every system might go down.
Which meant that he wouldn�t be able to get the fluids into his body and end 
up dead in the end anyway, without a single bot even knowing just what had 
gone wrong.
However, at the moment he was resisting stasis lock, which had been 
continuously pushing and threatening to take over for the past mega-cycle. 
If he simply let it take over his systems now he just might be able to keep 
his pump active a little longer and then he would surely sur..v�i�v�e�.
All at once, Dinobots systems began to buckle and fail, even the system, 
which held his beast mode as the dominant form at the moment. Which meant 
that his systems could no longer support the beast mode, and in an emergency 
overhaul he automatically transformed into robot mode.
Bad move!!
Dinobot instantly fell to his knees as soon as the transformation was 
complete, mech-fluid spilling onto the floor due to his re-exposed wounds.
The fourth fluid pump was straining, buckling, and finally�deactivated!
His breathing stopped!
He tried to rise to his feet to at least get him to the CR room in time, but 
everything was failing.
His lungs strained and tried to expand, to get air but their own functions 
had been deactivated and their attempts futile.
Dinobot, however, remained calm and very still, remembering that he now had 
20 cycles to get fluid into his body and reactivate his repair systems.
There was no point in panicking when it would only be for the worst.
But, again he tried to get to his feet, willing his body to at least 
function until he reached to entrance to the CR room.
But nothing was working, except�suddenly his internal computer activated 
with the status of his damage�**

I-COMP: � Respiratory functions have ceased, permanent lose of spark in 13.3 
cycles. Stasis lock activating in 5�4�3��

** And so it spoke out loud.
But the impending stasis lock was only another signature that death was 
closer then anybot could possibly know.
In a couple of seconds he would be out cold, and there wouldn�t be a bot in 
the world that would even know what was happening inside.
And while he was in stasis lock he still wouldn�t be able to bring air into 
his lungs, eventually dying from lack of oxygen to the brain.
However, with the failure of his systems was also the failure of his will 
power.
And with that he could no longer hold back stasis lock.**

I-COMP: ��2��

** But maybe there was still a chance, just a glimmer but a chance none the 
less.
With one desperate attempt he quickly linked his communicative systems with 
the only bot near him at the time, Tavatron. But with his weakness and 
oncoming stasis lock he could only hook up to her internal screen, only a 
mantel messages able of being sent.
With his systems failing, the message was scattered�**

��lungs���deacti����require���.fluids���syst���wil�.the���activa����������

I-COMP: ��1�0�Stasis lock ac�t�v�a��t��d�e��d.�

** And with that everything blacked out.
And with no conscious mind keeping the muscles of his body firm enough to 
keep him upright, Dinobots� body simply slumped heavily onto the floor.
Not even his chest rose and fell with the intake and exit of breath, his 
systems not even having enough energy to work with in order to reboot 
themselves.
So, the warriors� body simply lay there, a growing mass of mech-fluid 
flowing out from beneath it. But then, even that stopped, no longer any 
fluid left in the body to bleed.
But what would he think if he ever woke from this darkness, what would he 
ponder?
How could he have let himself get this injured? Or if he was a fool for 
saving another�s life when he would only end up like this?
Indeed, it was a puzzle to think.
But the real question to ponder was�would he ever live to dig into the 
shadows of his mind�again?**
